warning.overwrite: All existing user data will be overwritten. For users who do not present in the imported file, all related records will be removed from the system. The records to be removed include user logon data, group assignment, user customized session and session settings.

BZISConfirm.Header: Import user data from BlueZone Integration Server
BZISConfirm.label: Users
BZISConfirm.Content:
It seems you are importing user data from the BlueZone Integration Server. This process combines the site and page names to form group names and ignores the location column. In addition, the LU7 column maps to LU1, the LU8 maps to LU2, and so on. 
Click Import if this meets your requirements. Otherwise, click Cancel and refer to the Administrator Guide to change your CSV file manually. Then you can import the new file.

w2h.label: Standard Web Deployment
w2h.name: Standard Web Deployment
w2h.desc: The Standard Web Deployment mode is the default mode for Rocket TE Web Deployment Manager. When this deployment mode is configured, the user opens a web browser, navigates to a URL, clicks on a link, and Rocket TE is automatically downloaded and installed. The user uses a shortcut in desktop to start Rocket TE client sessions. This deployment mode also provides for "automatic" updates of the Rocket TE emulation clients.

sd.label: Served Desktop
sd.name: Served Desktop
sd.desc: The Served Desktop mode brings the benefits and familiarity of a desktop client with the convenience and advantages of a Rocket TE client install. Think of the Served Desktop mode as a way to use a web server to automatically deploy, install, and maintain Rocket TE as a standard Windows desktop application on many user workstations, without having to visit each of those workstations.

And you want to let all users in a certain department have access to this groups, you can input such like ou=department1

addFileModal.invalidFileSize: The file size should be less than {{fileSize}} KB.

stepUpload.uploadTitle: By compressing a site folder created by BlueZone Web-to-Host Wizard into a zip file and importing it here, your site’s launch folders and their sessions will be transitioned to Rocket TE Administration Console’s groups and session definitions automatically.

notes.text: All launch folders will be imported as groups.
All sessions of launch folder will be imported as sessions and assigned to the associated group.
The following session types will be ignored during import: TCP/IP Printer server, ALC display, T27 display and UTS display.
Binary format session profile need to be converted to text format before import, otherwise the session will not be imported.
The GUI/FTP locks configured in launch folder will be converted to privilege in the associated group.

stepAnalyze.title: The following launch folders are detected and will be migrated to groups, input to change the default group name.

ReportModal.label: Groups
ReportModal.summary: Importing site finishes. Here is the summary.
ReportModal.groupTitle: The following groups are created or updated.

groupCard.defaultGroupDescription: A system default group which contains all your users. This group is available when "Only use Default Group for user's access control" option is enabled.

authentication.changeAuthConfirm: Are you sure that you want to change authentication?
authentication.changeToNoneAuth: When setting None as the authentication method, RTE Web and its APIs will be accessible by anyone. This can be a security risk, especially when RTE Web is configured to serve public users through the internet. Are you sure that you want to change authentication?
authentication.defaultPassword: Notice: With authentication method change from {{auth}} to Rocket TE, the users created in {{auth}} method will get a default password as "{{password}} " until it’s reset.
authentication.restartNotifation: To update the user authentication method, restart the server. Until you restart the server, the authentication method is {{auth}}, and the identity source is {{source}}.
authentication.restartNotifation2: To update the user authentication method, restart the server. Until you restart the server, the authentication method is  {{auth}}.
authentication.restartNotifation3: To update the protocol configuration, restart the server.
authentication.Identitydescription: The identity source is an existing repository that stores user credentials.

noAuth.label: None
noAuth.description: Users are not authenticated; they access Rocket TE directly, without providing credentials.
noAuth.info: To assign privileges to these users, use the Default group, which is created automatically.

delete.title: Token
delete.info: Are you sure you want to delete "{{token}}"?

introduction.title: Token-based authentication for REST API:
introduction.message: To ensure security, the requests to Rocket TE REST API must include HTTP header "rte-api-token". And the value must match to a valid API Token below.

allows.label: Allowed web origins
allows.validationText: Allowed web origins fields are empty.
allows.detail: Comma-separated list of allowed origins for use with Cross-Origin Authentication, Device Flow, and web message response mode, in the form of <scheme> "://" <host> [ ":" <port> ], such as https://login.mydomain.com or http://localhost:3000. You can use wildcards at the subdomain level (e.g.: https://*.contoso.com). Query strings and hash information are not taken into account when validating these URLs.

bluezoneInternal.label: Rocket TE
bluezoneInternal.description: Users are authenticated by credentials that are stored in Rocket TE.

ldap.label: LDAP
ldap.description: Users are authenticated by an existing LDAP environment.

servername.label: Host name
servername.validation: Host name cannot include the following characters: ^%&',;=?$"

port.label: Port
port.validation: Port must be a number in the range 1 - 65535.

rootDN.label: Search base
rootDN.validation: The rootDN cannot include the following characters: ^%&',;=?$"

filter.label: Search filter
filter.validation: Filter cannot include the following characters: ^%&',;=?$"
filter.description: If your LDAP configuration does not include a uid attribute or does not have   meaningful uid values, enter mail={0}. Then users use their email addresses to log into Rocket TE.

returningAttributes.label: Return attributes
returningAttributes.validation: Return attributes cannot include the following characters: ^%&',;=?$"
returningAttributes.description: Specify the attributes that the LDAP query should return. Use these attributes to assign users to a group; If the attribute is not specified, the DN's value will be returned.

userIdSuffix.label: UserId Suffix
userIdSuffix.description: To avoid having to type like '@domain.com', use this can automatically append a domain name at the end of UserId, then pass into the LDAP to bind.

userIdPrefix.label: UserId Prefix
userIdPrefix.description: To avoid having to type like 'domain\', use this can automatically append a domain name at the before of UserId, then pass into the LDAP to bind.

managerDN.label: Manager DN
managerDN.description: If your LDAP server doesn't support anonymous binding (IOW, if your LDAP server doesn't even allow a query without authentication), then Rocket TE would have to first authenticate itself against the LDAP server, and Rocket TE does that by sending 'manager' DN and password. A DN typically looks like CN=MyUser,CN=Users,DC=mydomain,DC=com although the exact sequence of tokens depends on the LDAP server configuration. It can be any valid DN as long as LDAP allows this user to query data.

testing.description: Use your LDAP username and password to test your LDAP settings before saving. It is a good practice to verify a few other user accounts as well. you can use an empty password if you don't know their password to validate that user lookup is working.

sso.label: Single sign-on
sso.description: Users are authenticated by an existing single sign-on environment.

entityId.label: Entity ID
entityId.description: Unique identifier for the service provider, often the URL of the metadata file.

validation.format: The entity id format should be start with 'urn:'

assertEndpoint.label: Assert endpoint
assertEndpoint.description: Assert endpoint(usually called Assertion Consumer Service URL) of the service provider. No need to change it unless the host name does not contain the full domain name or the host name is "localhost".

privateKey.label: Private key
privateKey.description: Private key for the service provider.

validation.fileError: Private key is invalid, file size is 0 KB
Certificate is invalid, file size is 0 KB

alt_private_keys.label: Additional private keys
alt_private_keys.description: This field determines your additional private key(s) useful for adding backward-compatibility for old certificates after a rollover

validation.fileError: Additional private key is invalid, file size is 0 KB

alt_certs.label: Additional certificates
alt_certs.description: This field determines your additional certificate(s) useful for staging new certificates for rollovers.

validation.fileError: Additional certificate is invalid, file size is 0 KB

audience.label: Audience
audience.description: The audience of the SAML assertion. Default will be the entity id on SAML request

validation.format: The audience format should be start with 'urn:'

nameid_format.label: Name ID format
nameid_format.description: Format for Name ID. Identifies the SAML processing rules and constraints for the assertion's subject statement. Use the default value of 'Unspecified' unless the application explicitly requires a specific format.

validation.format: The format should be start with 'urn:'

notbefore_skew.label: Not before skew (Seconds)
notbefore_skew.description: To account for clock skew between IdP and SP, accept responses with a NotBefore condition ahead of the current time (according to our clock) by this number of seconds. Defaults to 1. Set it to 0 for optimum security but no tolerance for clock skew.

validation.format: The value should be a number between 0-99999.

sso_login_url.label: SSO login url
sso_login_url.description: This field determines your SAML2 identity provider login url

sso_logout_url.label: SSO logout url

force_authn.label: Force re-authentication
force_authn.description: If checked, forces re-authentication of users even if the user has a SSO session with the IdP

allow_iframe.label: Allow iframe embedding
allow_iframe.description: If checked, allow Rocket TE to embed the IdP in an iframe

samlCertificate.label: Identity Provider Certificate

oauth.label: HTTP Authorization Header
oauth.description: Users are authenticated by an existing HTTP Authorization Header environment.

tooltip.basic: This method is usually set by an authenticating reverse proxy server such as Microsoft's ISA Server. This header should be a base-64 encoded string, which contains the current user ID.

basic.step1: Choose "Basic access - no password" in case you want to by-pass the login page, and user identity is recognized from HTTP header.
basic.step2: This HTTP header is usually set by your authenticating reverse proxy. The header format is: Authorization: Basic <credentials>, where credentials is the Base64 encoding of ID and password joined by a single colon :.
basic.step3: End user can access to the product through URL:

validation.org_url: Okta Org URL must start with https://
validation.loginCallback: Login callback url must start with http:// or https://

info.step1: 1. Sign up for a Duo account.
info.step2: 2. Log in to the Duo Admin Panel and navigate to Applications.
info.step3: 3. Click Protect an Application and locate the entry for Web SDK or OneLogin in the applications list.
info.step4: 4. Click Protect to the far-right to configure the application and get your integration key, secret key, and API hostname.

info.step1: 1. Sign up for an Okta account for a unique Okta Org URL.
info.step2: 2. Log in to the Okta Admin Panel and navigate to Applications.
info.step3: 3. Create a web application with the OpenID Connect sign-on method. Then you can get a ClientID and Client secret from the General panel.
info.step4: 4. Check the login callback url of {{productName}}. You don’t need to change it unless the host name does not contain the full domain name or the host name is "localhost".
info.step5: 5. Copy the login callback url and update the Login redirect URIs of the web application with it.

app.label: App
app.info: A phone app to get MFA codes when prompted during sign-in

algorithm.label: Algorithm
algorithm.info: The algorithm used for calculating the HMAC

window.label: Window
window.info: Tokens in the previous and future x-windows that should be considered valid

onlyDefaultGroupMode.label: Only use "Default Group" for users' access control
onlyDefaultGroupMode.info: A "Default Group" will be created automatically where you can manage all your users' access, like which sessions they can access, what privileges they can have, and so on.

matchedGroupMode.label: Map authenticated user to group when:
matchedGroupMode.info: When this option is enabled, if an authenticated user is not assigned to any group, use the mapping rule to match the user to the corresponding group.
matchedGroupMode.mail: User's email domain matches group name
matchedGroupMode.urlParam: URL query parameter matches group name

varConfigure.label: Map user attributes to script variables
varConfigure.tooltip: Rocket TE scripts can accept variables which can be passed to RTE client based on the mapping below, enter the user attribute names (such as mail, username or other) to map to the script variables (Var1 to Var9). This feature is only available for Standard Web Deployment mode.

var.help4api: Enter the attribute name of JSON response body

api.label: Call RESTful API and map JSON response to script variables
api.tooltip: Enable this option if you want to create new attributes (such as login string for the host system) based on the user attributes, you need to design a RESTful API, and RTE Web Deployment Manager will make a call to your API with the user attributes as HTTP request body, your API should return a JSON format response which includes the new created attributes, then you can enter the attribute names of the JSON response to map to the script variables.

headers.label: Headers
headers.tooltip: Enter the HTTP request header, 'Authorization' header can be used if your RESTful API requires Basic Authentication.

ignorePasswordMode.label: Ignore user password for authentication
ignorePasswordMode.info: When this option is enabled, a user’s password is not required for authentication. Users can login with only their User ID.

httpHeader.label: First try to authenticate with HTTP authorization header
httpHeader.info: When this option is enabled, the system first tries to extract a user ID from the HTTP header “Authorization” and then authenticates with the user ID. If no such user ID exists in the system, the user is redirected to the login page. The HTTP authorization header is usually set by your authenticating reverse proxy. The header format is: Authorization: Basic <credentials>.

cluster.disableAddNodeButtonTitle: It cannot add node under Single singon authentication
cluster.prompt: Enable cluster nodes for load balance
cluster.introduce: Rocket TE cluster provides capacities of High Availability and Load Balancing. Nodes inside cluster work together as a peer-to-peer network. Configurations and data changes made on one node are synchronized to all other nodes automatically through TCP connections. Each node can provide full functions as Administration Console and Terminal Emulation application server.
cluster.introducePort:
On the first startup, server finds an available port number since 8643. This port will be used for communication between peer nodes inside cluster. 
In case this port is in use by other process, the status will be Not Listening, and clustering functions won't work. Please make sure the port is not occupied by other application.
cluster.chartNote: Note: click a node to push the data to others nodes

notification.inActiveNode: It's not suggested to delete a "{{status}}" node, this action might cause wrong status of the cluster.
notification.subTitle: node:
notification.statusError: Can not remove node in status "{{status}}".

addNode.peerDesp: Copy the peer metadata from the administrator console of the node to be added into cluster.

roles.name: Role
roles.detailAdmin: This role has all the privileges to manage and access the entire Rocket TE Administration Console except Administrators.

roles.detailOpAdmin: This role could only view user reports.

importData.titleBzw2h: Import site created by BlueZone Web-to-Host Wizard

details.text: If you are using BlueZone Web-to-Host Wizard 7.1, you can compress a site folder into a zip file and import it by clicking "Import site" button.

importData.view: Watch video: How to import data

upgradeData.title: Upgrade data from a previous version of Rocket Terminal Emulator
upgradeData.titleBzw2h: Upgrade data from a previous version of Rocket Terminal Emulator

details.text: 1. In the "bzwapps" folder of the previous version of your Rocket Terminal Emulator/BlueZone, create a copy of the "deploy" folder, and rename it to "migrate".
2. In the "bzwapps" folder of your current Rocket Terminal Emulator, paste the newly-created "migrate" folder from Step # 1.
3. Click the "Upgrade data" button to complete the upgrade.

upgradeData.view: Watch video: How to upgrade data

wsPingPongInterval.label: Websocket ping/pong interval
wsPingPongInterval.desc: It maintains connection health by periodically checking responsiveness, preventing potential network or idle connection issues (Seconds)
wsPingPongInterval.tooltip: WebSocket ping/pong interval can be used to avoid experiencing timeout errors before a ping is sent to host. Typically it should be less than the timeout setting of your gateway. The default value is 5 minutes. So, for example, a timeout value of 6 minutus in gateway will ensure that the gateway does not send a timeout error before the client sends a ping. Otherwise, the session connection will be closed with a 1006 error after timeout.

validationText.min: Minimum webscoket ping/pong interval cannot be less than {{min}}.
validationText.max: Maximum webscoket ping/pong interval cannot be greater than {{max}}.
validationText.integer: Webscoket ping/pong interval must be an integer.

maxPowerpadRow.label: Max powerpad row
maxPowerpadRow.desc: Max powerpad row to display for client user, the maximum value is 3 and the minimum value is 1

validationText.min: Minimum powerpad row cannot be less than {{min}}.
validationText.max: Maximum powerpad row cannot be greater than {{max}}.
validationText.integer: Powerpad rows must be an integer.

validationText.integer: Session expiration time must be an integer.
